Lord Malgus. Hammer Station has been destroyed.
I have seen the reports--you faced formidable opposition.
The Supreme Warmaster of the Advozse Hegemony has offered his life in reparation for his people's misdeeds. The Advozsec will never again pose a threat.
Destroy their planets, and I guarantee they won't rise again.
Now let's wipe them out.
Potential tools need not be destroyed--but it is under consideration.
They fought well. They could be useful under Imperial control.
We should make them join us.
A reasonable approach. I will consider it.
They weren't impressive.
You may also wish to hear that Intelligence has decrypted the station's data. We know how the Advozse Hegemony obtained a Republic superweapon.
...located the station in close orbit around a white dwarf. We believe the Republic intended to destroy it in the sun's photosphere.
Our salvage team will begin repairing its hyperdrive immediately, but reconstruction of the weapons will take some time....
It was Republic incompetence, not malice, that resulted in the Advozsec's rise to power. There is a lesson in that.
The lesson is that when the next war comes, the Republic doesn't stand a chance.
Our enemies are fools.
So long as our own strength is true.
When the galaxy learns that the Republic is responsible for every death Hammer Station caused, the Republic will face an uprising.
We should publicize this.
And they will grow weaker until we strike again.
You may return to your duties--but know that you have done well. You may be called upon again.
I didn't come here for a lesson. Your enemies are dead--is there anything else?
Don't get pompous with me.
There is nothing. But you may hear from me again.

This is Vaiken Spacedock, receiving on secure channel.
Good. You are few, but you must suffice.
Hammer Station was an armored fortress built by the Republic during the war. Its primary weapon was a gravity cannon designed to propel asteroids into planets.
The Republic Senate decommissioned it before it saw battle, fearing it would cause indiscriminate damage--but now the battle station has reappeared.
Your message mentioned the Advozse Hegemony. Hammer Station is now theirs?
You said aliens had it....
Yes.
You show up in hologram, treat me like your personal strike force... I need to know who you are.
Hold on--what's your story?
I am Darth Malgus--I fought in the Battle of Korriban. I turned the Jedi Temple on Coruscant to rubble. I will tell you what you "need."
Tell me what you've learned.
The trouble never ends.
The Advozse Hegemony is a minor galactic power based on xenophobic expansionism. The Advozsec themselves never troubled us before now.
But somehow, they've acquired Hammer Station and begun conquering unaligned systems near our border.
They're challenging the Empire.
They've become a threat.
Where did the Advozsec get their hands on a decommissioned Republic battle station?
How did they get the station?
An excellent question. I have no satisfying answer.
I can't say I care.
The fate of the conquered does not concern me.
The Advozse Hegemony believes that because we are at peace with the Republic, we will ignore the aggression of other nations.
Their conquests are rightfully ours. You will show them their error by boarding and destroying Hammer Station.
At last, I will bring war to an enemy.
Let the battle begin.
There will be more opportunities to come.
A violent culture with a powerful weapon could be made to serve.
They might yet be useful.
Indeed--once they're put in their place.
A surgical strike to destroy our enemy's greatest weapon. The Advozsec won't be a problem much longer.
Infiltrate and destroy.
I don't work without a contract. Not even for a Darth.
What about payment?
I have dealt with bounty hunters before--you will be satisfied.
I will obey.
And if I don't cooperate?
Suppose I refuse....
I will leave the consequences to others--but cowardice does not suit you.
While you're aboard, there is one other matter. I would know how Hammer Station was acquired, and whether the Republic was involved.
But do not allow yourself to be distracted--the station has a crew complement of ten thousand Advozsec, and they shall stand against you.
